name: Peda
history: Peda is a popular Indian sweet that originated in the state of Uttar Pradesh. It is traditionally made with khoya and flavored with cardamom, making it a staple in Indian festivities and celebrations.
description: Peda is a soft, fudge-like confection typically made from khoya (dried whole milk), sugar, and cardamom. These small, round sweets are often garnished with nuts like pistachios or almonds.

instructions.title: Prepare the Khoya
instructions.description: Grate or crumble the khoya into a heavy-bottomed pan.

instructions.title: Cook the Mixture
instructions.description: Add sugar to the khoya and cook on a low flame. Stir continuously until the mixture thickens and starts to leave the sides of the pan.

instructions.title: Add Flavors
instructions.description: Add cardamom powder and ghee to the mixture. Mix well until combined.

instructions.title: Shape the Pedas
instructions.description: Let the mixture cool slightly. When it's cool enough to handle, shape into small, flat discs.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish each peda with chopped pistachios. Serve at room temperature.

tips: Ensure continuous stirring to prevent the mixture from sticking or burning.
If the mixture becomes too dry, add a little milk to adjust the consistency.
variations: Chocolate Peda: Add cocoa powder to the mixture for a chocolate twist.
Coconut Peda: Mix in desiccated coconut for a different flavor and texture.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.
storage.instructions: Store in a cool, dry place.

reheatingInstructions: Not applicable, as pedas are served at room temperature.
presentationTips: Arrange pedas on a decorative platter, lined with a doily.
Serve with a cup of hot tea or coffee as a delightful snack or dessert.
